title: Some problem about process_robotcar_images.py
body:
Dear Author:
    Sorry to bother. Because a lot of time need to be used in the training of RobotCar Full Scene using Nivida TITAN Xp (5 epoch per day), I try the the process_robotcar_images.py for hoping to speed up training. But, I got some unexpected problem while running the program.

/usr/bin/python2.7 /media/duanzd/local/experiment/1/GAL/geomapnet-master/scripts/process_robotcar_images.py --scene full
fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git
  File "/media/duanzd/local/experiment/1/GAL/geomapnet-master/scripts/process_robotcar_images.py", line 38, in <module>
    transform = transforms.Compose([transforms.Scale(256),
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torchvision/transforms/transforms.py:208: UserWarning: The use of the transforms.Scale transform is deprecated, please use transforms.Resize instead.
  "please use transforms.Resize instead.")
processing TRAIN data using 4 cores
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/media/duanzd/local/experiment/1/GAL/geomapnet-master/scripts/process_robotcar_images.py", line 71, in <module>
    for batch_idx, (imgs, _) in enumerate(loader):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 336, in __next__
    return self._process_next_batch(batch)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 357, in _process_next_batch
    raise batch.exc_type(batch.exc_msg)
TypeError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 106, in _worker_loop
    samples = collate_fn([dataset[i] for i in batch_indices])
  File "/media/duanzd/local/experiment/1/GAL/geomapnet-master/dataset_loaders/robotcar.py", line 139, in __getitem__
    img = self.transform(img)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torchvision/transforms/transforms.py", line 60, in __call__
    img = t(img)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torchvision/transforms/transforms.py", line 195, in __call__
    return F.resize(img, self.size, self.interpolation)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torchvision/transforms/functional.py", line 229, in resize
    raise TypeError('img should be PIL Image. Got {}'.format(type(img)))
**TypeError: img should be PIL Image. Got <type 'numpy.ndarray'>**

Process finished with exit code 1

Does any one meets this problem?

Best wishes!
